question: When a tertiary alcohol <katex>$A'(C_{4}H_{10}O)$</katex> reacts with 20% <katex>$H_{3}PO_{4}$</katex> at 358 K, it gives a compound 'B' <katex>$(C_{4}H_{8})$</katex> as a major product. The IUPAC name of the compound 'B' is:
explanation: Tertiary alcohol is tert-butyl alcohol. Dehydration gives Isobutylene, which is 2-Methylpropene.
